conclusion: Triangle ABC is a right triangular prism with ∠A = 90° and ∠B = 60°; light path follows D → E → F → outside; E is on side AC, F is on side AB; EG ⊥ AC; G is the intersection of EG with BC; D is the midpoint of CG.
Incident ray at D appears to be parallel to AC.
At E, light undergoes regular reflection; at F, it undergoes total internal reflection.
The angle of deviation is the angle between the incident ray at D and the final ray after exiting at F.
Ray from D to E forms equal angles with BC due to D being the midpoint of CG and EG being perpendicular to AC.
Initial ray is parallel to AC, reflects at E toward F, undergoes total internal reflection at F, and exits.
Initial ray direction is parallel to AC, making an angle of 30° with the horizontal; after reflections and exit, the ray makes a 90° angle with the initial direction.
